item.title: Data Science Director - Global Advanced Customer Analytics
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

Who We Are
 

Manulife’s Advanced Customer Analytics team works across our global insurance and wealth management businesses to accelerate the use of Advanced Analytics & AI to understand the voice of the customer – both what they say and how they interact with us.  With an eye towards creating personalized products and digital service experiences we will play a key role in the organizations commitment to be a digital, customer leader. 
 

What You Will Do

You will be at the center of where Advanced Analytics meets customer experience. Your team will engage with both business and technical executive leadership to identify areas where analytics can delight customers.  Your team will pioneer predictive servicing solutions, use Natural Language Processing techniques to understand the voice of the customer, experiment with journey analytics to resolve pain points in our online experiences.  You will act as a lynchpin across multiple teams to accelerate these capabilities across our global businesses.

 
The Role Will Be Directly Responsible For
 

  • Execute our strategy to improve customer experiences through targeted, digital interventions, using Advanced Analytics & AI to develop insights about the voice of the customer

  • Coordinate with global advanced analytics teams, business stakeholders, and technology teams to create re-usable capabilities that can be easily shifted into new markets

  • Lead the creation of a customer analytics record encompassing all elements of meaningful customer data, curated for Advanced Analytics & AI use cases

  • Review and analyze existing processes to identify customer pain points. Work with large amounts of call center, web and other data sources to build holistic view of customer journey

  • Innovate and find creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies and NLP

  • Provide thought leadership and drive innovative solutions that influence how data insights are delivered to the client throughout Manulife

  • Work with Customer Experience, Human Center Design, Operations and IT teams to bring your ideas to production and bring real change in customer experience

Typical Qualifications
 

Bachelor’s Degree with 10+ year’s experience, or Master’s with any of the following fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, Epidemiology, Public Health or other related quantitative fields.

Professional Experience may include

  • Expertise delivering analytic & machine learning products, with a deep understanding of agile product delivery in an enterprise environment

  • Building and leading project teams in a matrix environment, managing cross functional teams

  • Experience leading or working with data scientists and engineers

  • Deep understanding of with machine learning and advanced analytics concepts

  • Familiarity with cloud analytics services and MLOps

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to engage the enterprise across multiple specializations with analytically backed compelling stories

  • Proven project management and planning skills

  • Prior experience with insurance or financial services is not required

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

Summary

Calling on a Machine Learning Engineer who can seamlessly combine tech know-how with business acumen to go from a promising ML experiment to a shipped product, with real-world impact.


You will join the Canadian Advanced Analytics team to focus on delivering machine learning models into production and accelerate the development of ML solutions across Canada Segment. You will enable data scientists to translate models they create into optimized full-fledged AI/ML products and improve the maintainability of models by providing a common set of infrastructure and monitoring capabilities (MLOps).


Not only are you experienced in ML tech stack, but you have a firm grasp of Azure PaaS technologies, platforms and applications, and have intimate knowledge of how best to customize these for our business, to help us become more efficient. A true greenfield opportunity, you will join the team as we embark on cloud native architecture.

Key Accountabilities

  • Build end-to-end machine learning solutions to solve complex customer problems

  • Manage data science infrastructure to streamline model development and deployment

  • Working in collaboration with customers across Canadian business to plan, scope, implement and sustain predictive analytics solutions

  • Architecting, developing, optimizing and owning the deployment of ML functionalities into production systems

  • Design and evaluate new approaches for handling high-volume real-time data streams in an inferencing environment

  • Defining best practices for code, APIs, and frameworks that will lay the foundation for MLOps capabilities

  • Proposing appropriate tools (languages/libraries/frameworks) for implementing projects

  • Working closely with Infrastructure architects to design scalable and cost-effective solutions

  • Perform ETL to build model features

  • Following Software Deployment and QA processes and MLOps best practices

  • Develop measurements and feedback systems

  • Mentor associates and peers on DevOps/MLOps best practices

Key Experiences:

  • At least 3 years of hands-on experience with large-scale systems in data science / software engineering

  • Strong software development skills (+3 years working experience) with proficiency in Python

  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and SQL

  • Minimum 1 year of experience in productionizing code through DevOps pipeline (git, Jenkins pipeline, code scan) the last 3 years 

  • Experience in infrastructure, including Cloud Computing, Linux OS, Networks, Docker, RDBMS and NoSQL Databases

  • Experience working with cloud native architecture (PaaS) using Azure stack preferably and experience with Azure ML, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory will be an asset.

  • Experience with Infrastructure as code (Terraform/ARM) desirable but not mandatory

  • Working experience in building and deploying machine learning models as REST-based API using Flask, Elasticsearch, GraphQL, etc

  • Experience in building ETL pipelines to perform feature engineering on large-scale dataset using Spark

  • An ability to balance a sense of urgency with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions

  • Experience with user interface design (UX, PowerBI, node.js) and iterative customer-driven design processes would be an asset.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

This data engineer has accountability as a data domain subject matter expert, building automated capabilities and data products to accelerate advanced analytics.  The data engineer is responsible for designing and building business interpretable and performant analytics solutions.  The data engineer builds re-usable and modular, self-service capabilities to continuously increase the capacity of the advanced analytics team. The data engineer leverages and shares their deep knowledge of, and experience with, a wide variety of data analytics and technology topics.  The data engineer helps others to improve their knowledge and understanding of the use of data and technology.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide data subject matter expertise
  • Responsible for understanding the systems & data environment.
  • Research, explore, and tinker with new data design ideas and related technologies.
  • Collaborate with internal/external data experts.
  • Research & leverage technical documentation to gain a holistic understanding of the data domain.
  • Support Analytics projects
  • Work with data scientists to transform business requests into value-add data products and capabilities.
  • Work closely with business teams and data scientists to collaboratively assess, understand, improve, and deliver rich data content for analysis.
  • Assist in the development the conceptual/logical data models or semantic layers with appropriate business contexts.
  • Automate, re-build, and re-imagine data processes to increase efficiencies in business processes.
  • Tactical support of data access, understanding, engineering, visualization, and decision making.
  • Elevate data and analytics skills in the business
  • Help people in the business better understand the use of data and automation, drawing on a thorough understanding of and experience with technologies for intelligent automation, data modeling, data management, etc.
  • Identifying and guiding natural data champions in the business to enhance the profitable use of data.
  • Learn salient business concepts from data champions and enable them to creatively use data technologies.

Qualifications:

  • University degree in quantitative based field (e.g. Mathematics, Physics, and Engineering).
  • Advanced experience with databases.
  • Advanced Experience in Python, SQL, Spark, C#, etc.
  • Advanced Experience in automating data pipelines and working with data transformation tools.
  • Advanced experience working with internal business contacts to develop analytical reports.
  • Experience providing data analysis to support management decisions.
  • General knowledge of data analytics theory & application.
  • Experience with analytics tools and visualization tools a plus.
  • Experience with cloud technologies and Data as a Service (DaaS) a plus.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

Job Description

Manulife is looking for an exceptional senior data scientist to lead a center of excellence for the global retirement business. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive analytics techniques and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues, including sales, distribution, marketing and pricing.  This is a unique opportunity to join a creative and passionate growing team within a Fortune 500 organization. It is a lean, flat and experimental team that combines science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into business operation.  

Key Focus: Reporting to the Head of Analytics for US Retirement, the senior data scientist will take a leading part in the management of the analytics data environment as well as the review, creation and deployment of existing and new advanced models. The ideal candidate will have experience in a range of the big data space and technologies and stays on top of new development, trends and applies data engineering and science into the marketing and sales organization. The Senior Data Scientist develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to improve business process, to generate insights, support business goals and strategy development. The Senior Data Scientist also owns and delivers projects of diverse scope, oversees the work of more junior data scientists.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead technical projects that span the global retirement business with high impact on sales growth, business profitability, client retention and customer satisfaction

  • Lead complex data mining projects from creation, evaluation, testing and continuously improving using machine learning, and other modeling concepts

  • Innovate and find creative ways to source and use data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data, and big data technologies.

  • Handle data sets from disparate sources using appropriate engineering methodologies, computational frameworks and systems

  • Work with cross-functional global team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas.

  • Provide expertise on analytics concepts for the broader advanced analytics group, and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics, data engineering and data science across the organization

  • Oversees the work of junior data scientists.

​Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)

  • 3+ plus years developing of probabilistic models, data mining, and machine learning algorithms including real world experience in model development validation and testing and implementation

  • Experience in finance, marketing, Fin-tech industry is preferred

  • Expert in data analysis using Python, R, SQL; familiar with big data system, NoSQL systems, Hadoop/map-reduce, Spark, etc.

  • Track record of leading projects of diverse scope; independently provides analysis on datasets of significant complexity; recommends implementable solutions to (or in collaboration with) business partners

  • Strong data engineering, and data management expertise with demonstrated data transformation and manipulation experience

  • Strong commitment to organizational success and team work; highly focused on accountability.

  • Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely

  • Inspires and motivates others, provides courageous advice.

  • Role model of ethics and integrity who builds a culture of respect.

  • Ability to handle multiple partners

  • Strategic perspective.

  • Highly collaborative working style

#LI-JH


If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description

Job Summary:  

 

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in leading transformational projects in our Group Benefits business. Your broad knowledge of predictive analytics techniques will impact the lives of millions of Canadians, support Canadian businesses with the retention of employees, while managing costs, and enable Manulife employees with cutting edge solutions that deliver exceptional customer experiences. 

 

As a senior member of the Group Benefits data science team, you will collaborate with business leaders in Fraud, Disability Management, Operations, Product, Sales, Pricing and Underwriting to identify opportunities to apply advanced analytic algorithms and technologies (e.g. machine learning, artificial intelligence, deep learning) to deliver predictions and/or intelligent automation that will enable smarter business decisions, improved health outcomes, exceptional customer experiences and higher productivity for our Group Benefits team.  

Responsibilities: 

  • Consults with internal business leaders, identifies opportunities/challenges, and brings analytics driven insights/solutions to solve business problems.

  • Helps determine advanced analytics priorities and sequencing of projects to optimize business goals.  Works closely with business leaders in change management as an outcome of model delivery.

  • Leads, develops, manages, and delivers projects of diverse scope. 

  • Codifies processes/techniques/tools into best practices for other data scientists. Oversees the work of more junior data scientists.  Participates in code and model review of other data scientists.

  • Works with Customer Experience, Human Center Design, Operations, and IT teams to bring model outputs to life to support business processes, and end users.

  • Provides thought leadership including researching new analytics methodologies, tools, and data 

  • Innovates and finds creative ways to source data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies and NLP 

  • Actively involved in recruiting data science professionals and manages data science co-ops 

 

Qualifications:  

  • An advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline

  • Minimum 5 years of commercial experience solving high impact business problems using data science

  • Experience leading initiatives across the entire advanced analytics lifecycle from business problem through to deployment

  • Practical experience with big data processing frameworks, and platforms such as Azure, Databricks, Spark, Hive, PCF 

  • Excellent communication skills – able to translate complex data science concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Masterful storyteller able to galvanize others to act.

  • Agile thinker with a bias for action, able to remove roadblocks fast. 

  • Track record of implementing models into production with business value.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity.
